buginformation.summary: CQLSH exception handling could leave a session in a bad state
buginformation.description: Playing with CTRL+C in a cqlsh session can leave the (Thrift|Native) connection in a bad state.To reproduce :1) Run a long running COPY FROM command (COPY test (k, v) FROM '/tmp/test.csv')2) Interrupt the importer with CTRL+CRepeat step 1 and 2 until you start seeing weird things in the cql shell (see attached screenshot)The reason is, I believe, the connection (and the cursor) is not correclty closed and reopened on interruption.I am working to propose a fix.Jordan

buginformation.summary: Removing a seed causes previously removed seeds to reappear
buginformation.description: When you remove a seed from a cluster, Gossiper.removeEndpoint ensures it is removed from the seed list. However, it also resets the seed list to be the original list, which would bring back any previously removed seeds. What is the reasoning for having the call to buildSeedsList()? buginformation.summary: Make gc_grace_seconds 7 days for system tables
buginformation.description: The system tables have had a gc_grace_seconds of 8640 since CASSANDRA-4018. This was probably a typo and was intended to be 10 days. In CASSANDRA-6717 we will set gc_grace to seven days, so that would be a reasonable value to use here.
